newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico crude port Dos Bocas partially reopen--port.
newsitem.headline: Mexico crude port Dos Bocas partially reopen--port.

text.p: Mexican crude port Dos Bocas reopened Monday at 1825 local/2325 GMT as wind speeds relaxed in the Gulf of Mexico to between 35 and 40 kilometers per hour, port officials said.
Still dangerous waves of between eight and 10 feet high prompted the port to suspend tugboat activity at 0615 local Tuesday.
Without tugboat operations, crude oil tankers cannot sail from the port, officials told Reuters.
Port officials said they would check the weather throughout the day to determine whether the tugboats could resume operations.
Mexico's second largest crude export port had been shut since late Saturday when storms hit the gulf.
Pajaritos in Veracruz state reopened earlier Monday, Communications and Transport Ministry said.

Dos Bocas exported an average of 505,900 barrels per day (bpd) in 1996, Pajaritos exported about 416,200 bpd and Cayo Arcas shipped an average 576,300 bpd, according to the latest state oil and company Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) figures.
